meanings.sent1: She used a hammer to widen the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The road will widen as it approaches the city.
meanings.sent3: Trying to widen a smile while eating a lemon is quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: His eyes widened in surprise as he saw the breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The magician used a trick to widen the small box into a large one.

meanings.definition: To increase in extent or scope.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to widen its product range next year.
meanings.sent2: Her knowledge of history widened after reading many books.
meanings.sent3: The joke about the expanding balloon made everyone widen their eyes in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the new law widened the possibilities for small businesses.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two countries began to widen, leading to more collaborations.
